/* See also */ Add Nuclear free zone link!
Fixing [[Wikipedia:Disambiguation pages with links|links to disambiguation pages]] using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
splitting up long and awkwardly worded intro sentence
/* Events of August 7-9 */ NPOV wording "unilateral abrogation" does not imply that the treaty was or was not "broken".
/* Events of August 7-9 */ The reference enough shows that PBS translated it.
No, the [[Soviet-Japanese Neutrality Pact]] ran through April 1946. The Soviets had merely announced that they weren't going to renew it for another five years.
Having withdrawn from the [[neutrality pact]] on [[August 5]],
/* Events of August 7-9 */ the USSR had already renounced the neutrality pact
There can be no "minor edits" of this topic: changed the Aug 10 Nagasaki leaflet-dropping to remark how ironic it was
RV; one victim picture is enough, IMO
RV; a large picture with very little value, IMO
removing paragraph that repeats material elsewhere; a couple of small edits to remove some uncited POV terms
/* Support */ correct re-fix to fix of missing word
/* Cultural notes */ Cultural references may be a better name

/* Debate over bombings */ removing 2 subheadings, per discussion
/* Opposition */ fixing screwy sentence, removing unnecessary "where to look" instruction from reference
/* Support */ added mention of probable Japanese casualties
/* Support */ partial rewrite of the section
removing link to subscription-required source, removing un-useful ASIN number
/* References and further reading */ Split into "References" and further reading.

rv to last version by PBS. See talk

/* References */ whoops missed some double citations
Move commented out references into further reading
/* References */ Check old reference list against new reference list
/* References */ list of references from citations, sorted on author's family name
/* References */ unsorted list of references taken from citations (mostly books but some web links as well)
deleted some white spaces in citations --No need for them to span lines. As this article is so large consideration should be given to removeing the templates in the citations
Put back to obvious changes between the revert of references and further reading. more to come
Rv to 5:20, 23 January 2007 KarlBunker. Fix the sections References and Further reading. References should be all the articles and books cited (more than once). Further reading background etc
rv; the single brackets were deliberate
/* Plans for more atomic attacks on Japan */
/* Histories and descriptions */ fixing italics tag in "et al"
/* References and further reading */ rm duplicate
/* Histories and descriptions */ more cite book formatting tweaks
/* References and further reading */ reformatting, removing duplicates, removing bad links, adding ISBNs etc.
/* References and further reading */ Merging "Histories of events" and "Descriptions of the bombings" since they're both histories, other small changes
/* Debates over the bombings, and their portrayal */ Using cite book/cite web format, adding in items from other section, seperating print from online sources
/* Decision to use the bomb */ moving items from this section to other sections, removing duplicates and subscription-required links
There's no apparent distinction between "references" and 'further reading", so I'm merging the sections
"Cultural notes" is part of the article, so moving it up out of the "References" section
/* Further reading */ rm extradeous white spaces

/* Further reading */ consolidated two links to Manhattan Project account

/* Histories of the events */ restored entry re Charles Sweeney book (in different section)

/* Inherently immoral */ cleaning up recent edit and its citations
rv; whether extreme or not, this opinion is one-sided. WP can describe a debate, but can't favor one side or another unless a clear majority of scholars do so
rv. i reverted wrong version last time
rv. opinion is not extreme. it is an opinion about an extreme event. 'hiroshima genocide' in google gives half a milion results. how extreme is that?
added map per request on Talk page
